New Records: The Cubs have now scored 5+ runs in 12 straight road games - a new franchise record
Key Match Events: The Cubs pounded out 11 hits and hit three home runs
Michael Busch had two home runs while rookie Pete Crow-Armstrong had one as well
Pre-Game Insights: The Cubs are still mathematically alive in the National League wild card race, but they are 5.0 games back of both the New York Mets and Atlanta Braves for the final spot
Post-Match Reflections: The Cubs will be back in action on Monday night when they host the Oakland Athletics at Wrigley Field
Miscellaneous Highlights: The loss dropped the Rockies to 57-93, one of the three worst records in the entire league
Others: The Cubs utilized the run game in the win, getting stolen bases from Nick Hoerner, Seiya Suzuki and Dansby Swanson
